text: dino has to set itself apart right and
type script was one of the ways that it
kind of did that to start what were the
other big ideas that dino has
that sets it apart from everything else
first important aspect is that it's
written in rust instead of c plus plus
node is a very large c plus project
and not sure how you guys feel about
this but i'm very convinced that i will
never start another c
plus project rust really solves the c
plus plus problem as it were and then i
think that there's many great things
about rust but the thing
that is most important to me is the
ability
to have a single build system so
this cargo system of linking together
different rust crates
in c plus plus there's no one defined
way of
how to take different c plus plus
libraries and
smash them together so you know chrome
has this gn
project node uses this jip project
there's cmake
there's a lot of different tooling for
for kind of
compiling together dependencies in c
plus plus and this ends up being
a huge huge complexity in terms of
bringing in external third-party code
into a big project
and so you know in node days when we
want to
you know we built a web server and like
you know you have to parse http and it's
such a difficult problem that we ended
up writing our own http parser
for this it's so difficult to bring in
external code that you
end up often having to just write the
stuff over again
because it's so difficult to link and
this is very different in rust right if
i need
a yaml parser if i need hdp server
any sort of third-party stuff i would do
what people are used to doing in
javascript or ruby or python
you can just kind of include
dependencies and have this all
compiled together really nicely and
that's an important aspect for
a platform like dino or
node because you know we provide all of
these apis
to do various things right
you want to open a websocket you want to
have a http 2 web server
all these various systems that it talks
to need implementations
and it's very nice that we're able to
just link in
third party implementations of all these
various systems
pretty easily so from a maintainer's
perspective
rewriting it in rust is a really killer
feature that
kind of allows us to iterate much much
quicker
